transcript.title: TAXATION REFORM AND COMMONWEALTH-STATE FINANCIAL RELATIONS
transcript.content:
I am pleased to announce that today's Special Premiers'

Conference has endorsed a set of principles that will transform Commonwealth-State

financial relations as promised in the Howard Government's Tax

Reform: not a new tax, a new tax system.

These principles will provide the States and Territories with a stable

and growing source of revenue to fund important community services,

such as roads, hospitals and schools. It will allow the States to

reduce their reliance on a range of narrow and growth reducing taxes.

I congratulate State and Territory leaders on their co-operative and

constructive approach to today's meeting.

A copy of the Agreement on Principles is attached. This will guide

further work on the implementation details, leading up to our consideration

of a draft Intergovernmental Agreement at the 1999 Premiers'

Conference.

Canberra

13 November 1998
